snippet: Multinationals and local suppliers are increasingly going beyond local regulations in designing factories that cut energy costs and pollute less.
abstract: Multinationals and local suppliers in Asia are increasingly going beyond local regulations in designing factories that cut energy costs and pollute less; they are finding financial and public-relations benefits in increased efficiency.
lead_paragraph: Multinationals and local suppliers are increasingly going beyond local regulations in designing factories that cut energy costs and pollute less.

headline.main: Slowly, Asia’s Factories Begin to Turn Green
headline.print_headline: Slowly, Asia’s Factories Begin to Turn Green

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED)
